org.logicmill.util.concurrent

Interface ConcurrentHashMap.MapConfigBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConcurrentHashMap.Buildable, ConcurrentHashMap.LoadFactorSpec, ConcurrentHashMap.SegCountSpec
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConcurrentHashMap.MapConfigBuilderImpl
    Enclosing class:
    ConcurrentHashMap<K,V>

    public static interface ConcurrentHashMap.MapConfigBuilder
extends ConcurrentHashMap.SegCountSpec
    An object that creates a MapConfig. An object implementing this interface is returned by static MapConfig.create(), and serves as the anchor of a chain of invocations that populate it with data describing the configuration.
    Author:
    edgeofmagic

    • Method Detail

      • withSegmentSize

        ConcurrentHashMap.SegCountSpec withSegmentSize(int size)
        Indicates a suggested segment size for this configuration. The value of size is adjusted such that:

           sizeadjusted = 2 ⌈log2 (size)⌉

        that is, to the smallest power of 2 greater than or equal to size, and further adjusted if necessary so that it lies in the range [1024..229], inclusive.

        Parameters:
        size - suggested segment size
        Returns:
        object that constrains the subsequent operations in the chain to ensure proper invocation order

      • withExpectedMapSize

        ConcurrentHashMap.SegCountSpec withExpectedMapSize(int size)
        Indicates the expected nominal size of a map of this configuration in the intended application context. Expected map size is used to determine segment size, such that:

           segSizeestimated = √  estimatedMapSize 

           segSizeadjusted = 2 ⌈log2 (segSizeestimated)⌉

        that is, to the smallest power of 2 greater than or equal to the square root of estimated map size, and further adjusted if necessary so that it lies in the range [1024..229], inclusive.

        Parameters:
        size - the estimated size of the resulting map in the intended application context
        Returns:
        object that constrains the subsequent operations in the chain to ensure proper invocation order

      • withInitSegmentCount

        ConcurrentHashMap.LoadFactorSpec withInitSegmentCount(int count)
        Suggests a value for the number of segments created when a map is constructed. The value of count is adjusted, such that

           countadjusted = 2 ⌈log2 (count)⌉

        that is, to the smallest power of 2 greater than or equal to count, and further adjusted if necessary so that it lies in the range [2..n] inclusive, where

           n = 230/segSize

        where segSize is the segment size of the resulting configuration.

        Specified by:
        withInitSegmentCount in interface ConcurrentHashMap.SegCountSpec
        Parameters:
        count - suggested number of initial segments in a map of this configuration
        Returns:
        object that constrains the subsequent operations in the chain to ensure proper invocation order

      • withInitCapacity

        ConcurrentHashMap.LoadFactorSpec withInitCapacity(int capacity)
        Suggests a value for the initial capacity of a map of the resulting configuration. This value is used to determine the initial segment count (initSegCount for this configuration, such that:

           initSegCount = 2 ⌈log2 (capacity / segSize)⌉

        and the resulting initial segment count is further adjusted if necessary so that it lies in the range [2..n] inclusive, where

           n = 230/segSize

        where segSize is the segment size of the resulting configuration.

        Specified by:
        withInitCapacity in interface ConcurrentHashMap.SegCountSpec
        Returns:
        object that constrains the subsequent operations in the chain to ensure proper invocation order
